commitResults.messageTitle: Duke.java: Implement skeletal version (initial commit).
MyList.java: init custom list class
MyList.java: add return statement to indicate item added
Duke.java:  implement level 2 - add, list functions
Init new Item class and modify MyList to use it
add level 3: ability to mark tasks as done
Initialise Deadline, Event, ToDo classes, change Task to abstract class
Implement level 4 - todo, event, deadline
MyList.java: add feature to prevent duplicate tasks
Set up input and expected file, configure script for auto testing
Add checking if task is already completed
Initialise exceptions for Duke
Modify program to handle invalid input using exceptions
Add delete task function
Duke.java: removed irrelevant comment
Change code to suit coding convention and for consistency
Implement level 7 functionality (saving to and loading from disk)
Implement level 8: handling date and times using LocalDateTime, LocalDate, LocalTime classes
Refactor the code to extract out closely related code as classes
Organise the classes into java packages
commitResults.messageBody:
Package task contains class Task and its subclasses
Package exception contains custom DukeException class that contains all custom exceptions
Package utility contains the custom classes that enable the main program to read, parse, organise and return data

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement junit tests for Storage.java and Parser.java
Change name of log file
Edit code to follow coding convention and make generally more readable
Add feature to search for tasks using input keywords
Add javadocs
Parser.java: refactor parseNewTask method to make it less convoluted TaskList.java: rename methods to follow code convention
Enable running and building of duke using gradle (minimal for now)
Add support for checkstyle plugin; clean up code to meet coding standards
Add a GUI to Duke
Fix bugs related to storage and parsing saved log file
Make saving and loading of tasks OS-independent
Use assert feature to document important assumptions that should hold at various points
commitResults.messageBody:
There are some parts in the code that require specific restricted input
from the user. For example, when entering the line number of the task to
delete, the number needs to be a valid number i.e. greater than 0 but
less than or equal to the total number of tasks.

Not validating user input could break code execution or lead to
unexpected outcomes.

Let's add assert statements at the various junctures that require data
validation to catch any invalid user input.

This will help indicate to us the various precautions to take in
anticipation of invalid input from the user.

As far as I can tell, all the potential areas where input validation
could be an issue are either dealt with exceptions or assert statements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor code to improve code quality
commitResults.messageBody:
The methods in some classes (specifically those in the utility package)
have the same functionality. Some methods that deal with processing
user input also has convoluted if-else cases. Some input validation was
also done at the wrong place, e.g. Parser checking for duplicate tasks
when TaskList is the one in-charge of adding the task. The inclusion
of many messages in the main body is distracting and causes the main
code body to be cluttered.

The common functionalities across methods leads to code duplication.
Extensive if-else clauses and long methods inhibit readability and
understandability. Having some functionalities in the wrong class might
violate the tell-dont-ask principle.

Let's refactor the code so that everything is in its right place and
clean up the presentation.
* extract duplicate functionalities as a common method
* simplify if-else clauses and use guard clauses wherever necessary so
that code is easier to follow
* shorten long methods by extracting out auxiliary functionalities to
helper methods
* extract messages as constants which are placed away from the main body
of code
* ensure that the tell-dont-ask principle is followed by delegating the
job to the right class (e.g. validation for duplicate tasks should be
done by TaskList)
* other general code quality improvements

Improving code quality and readability makes debugging and further
developing much easier and smooth.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add new function to view all tasks (events/deadlines) occurring on a specified date
Update README.md and add Ui.png for webpage
